title: MySQLRIGHT()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLRIGHT()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Extract 4 characters from a string (starting from right):
SELECT RIGHT("SQL Tutorial is cool", 4) AS ExtractString;

Definition and Usage
The RIGHT() function extracts a number of characters from a string (starting 
from right).
Tip:
Also look at the
LEFT()
function.
Syntax
RIGHT(
string
,
number_of_chars
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. The string to extract from
number_of_chars
Required. The number of characters to extract. If this parameter is 
    larger than the number of characters in
string
, 
  this function will return
string
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Extract 5 characters from the text in the "CustomerName" column (starting from right):
SELECT RIGHT(CustomerName, 5) AS ExtractString
FROM Customers;

★
+1

quiz.question: What is SQL Tutorial?
options:
larger than the number of characters in
string
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of SQL Tutorial is 'cool"'.

quiz.question: What is If this parameter?
options:
larger than the number of characters in
string
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of If this parameter is 'larger than the number of characters in
string'.

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLRIGHT()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLRIGHT()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLRIGHT()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
